refnamediv.refpurpose: Loads a SoundFont into a fluidEngine, optionally listing SoundFont contents.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Plugin opcode in fluidOpcodes. This opcode is part of the plugin repository and has to be installed separately. The plugin repository can be found here: https://github.com/csound/plugins
Loads a SoundFont into an instance of a fluidEngine, optionally listing banks and presets for SoundFont.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: isfnum -- number assigned to just-loaded soundfont.
soundfont -- string specifying a SoundFont filename. Note that any number of SoundFonts may be loaded (obviously, by different invocations of fluidLoad).
ienginenum -- engine number assigned from fluidEngine

ilistpresets -- optional, if specified, lists all Fluidsynth programs for the just-loaded SoundFont. A Fluidsynth program is a combination of SoundFont ID, bank number, and preset number that is assigned to a MIDI channel.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: Invoke fluidLoad in the orchestra header, any number of times. The same SoundFont may be invoked to assign programs to MIDI channels any number of times; the SoundFont is only loaded the first time.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the fluidLoad opcode. It uses the file fluidLoad.csd and 07AcousticGuitar.sf2.
Example of the fluidLoad opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
The output should include a line like this:
SoundFont: 1 Bank: 0 Preset: 0 Seagul Acoustic Git
